text: in writing. — (IT) I voted in favour because this initiative will enable both parties to improve and intensify cooperation in scientific and technological fields of common interest and will allow the further exchange of specific knowledge and the transfer of know-how for the benefit of the scientific community, businesses and citizens.

name: Alberto CIRIO
text: in writing. — The neighbourhood policy, in the case of the Mediterranean as in the case of the Eastern Partnership, must go through the sharing of relatively important policies which will act as a driving force for wider convergence. I therefore welcome the renewal of the agreement with Ukraine, not least because of what is happening geopolitically. For this reason I confirm my support for this choice.

name: Carlos COELHO
text: in writing. — The Agreement on Scientific and Technological Cooperation between the European Community and Ukraine was signed in Copenhagen on 4 July 2007 for an initial period ending on 31 December 2012. In March 2011, the Council decided to renew the Agreement for an additional period of five years until November 2014. I support this initiative, which recommends the renewal of this Agreement for an additional period of five years, which will allow the continuity of scientific and technological relations between the European Union and Ukraine to continue. The renewal of this Agreement will enable both parties to improve and intensify their cooperation in scientific and technological areas of common interest and will contribute to the exchange of knowledge and transfer of know-how to the benefits of scientific communities and citizens. The Agreement is based on the principles of mutual benefit, reciprocity of access to programmes and activities of each party, non-discrimination, effective protection of intellectual property, equitable sharing of intellectual property rights, and the enhancement of results.

name: Lara COMI
text: in writing. - (IT) My vote was positive because I agree with the renewal of the existing agreement on scientific and technological cooperation with Ukraine. This has already brought important advantages in the scientific and technological fields of common interest to the contracting parties, Ukraine on the one hand and the EU on the other.  This renewal, lasting a further 5 years, will make it possible to continue to improve and intensify cooperation on the principles of mutual access to programmes and activities for the benefit of the scientific community, businesses and citizens.

name: Therese COMODINI CACHIA
text: in writing. — The initiative of renewing the Agreement on cooperation in science and technology between the European Community and Ukraine will allow both parties to improve and intensify their cooperation in science and technology in areas of common interest. The Agreement is based on the right principles, including mutual benefit, non-discrimination and protection of intellectual property. The renewing of this Agreement will allow for increased scientific knowledge leading to market access opportunities and is thus being done in the best interests of the scientific communities, industry and citizens.

name: Ignazio CORRAO
text: in writing. — This initiative will enable both parties to improve and intensify cooperation in scientific and technological fields of common interest and will enable the further exchange of specific knowledge and the transfer of know-how for the benefit of the scientific community, businesses and citizens. I could only vote in favour of this resolution because the agreement is based on the principles of mutual benefit and mutual access to the programmes and activities of the other Party, in relation to the subject matter of the agreement, non-discrimination, the effective protection of intellectual property, the fair distribution of intellectual property rights and the effective exploitation of results.

name: Javier COUSO PERMUY
text: in writing. — I voted against this report since I cannot accept as legitimate the current Government of Ukraine, which emerged from a coup d'a coup d'a. Therefore, I voted against it.

name: Miriam DALLI
text: in writing. - This initiative will allow the EU and Ukraine to improve and intensify cooperation in science and technology in areas of common interest and will allow further exchange of specific knowledge know-how to the benefit of the scientific communities, industry and the citizens. I voted in favour of the extension of this already existing agreement, to increase scientific knowledge and enhance new market access opportunities.

name: Rachida DATI
text: In writing. For more than ten years, the European Union and Ukraine have maintained scientific and technological cooperation for the benefit of both partners, in a spirit of mutual benefit which I wish to encourage development. In this sense, the renewal of the scientific and technological cooperation agreement is a positive sign, especially as it is accompanied by relevant assessment tools.

name: Mireille D'ORNANO
text: In writing. — The renewal of cooperation agreements with Ukraine comes against a very tense context and largely the result of provocations outside the European continent, which are taken up by the European Union in view of the geopolitical balances of Eastern Europe. In order not to participate in this inflaming and to mark my neutrality on the Ukrainian issue, I voted against this report.

name: Georgios EPITIDEIOS
text: Writing. — I voted against the recommendation because at this time any agreement with Ukraine intensifies the confrontation with Russia, a situation which I consider disastrous for the EU.

name: José Manuel FERNANDES
text: in writing. - Approves the renewal of the cooperation agreement and the sharing of specific knowledge and know-how in the fields of science and technology, areas that are clearly beneficial for scientific progress. Therefore, all agreements promoting such mechanisms are necessarily salutary, bearing in mind that it is the renewal of a previously existing Agreement (its validity expired on 7 November 2014) and that there is a transposition of the content of the old Agreement into the new, in particular the principles of mutual benefit, the effective protection of intellectual property and the equitable sharing of intellectual property rights. The interests of the European Union are being cautious through the revision of this new Agreement, which allows the Commission to regularly monitor all actions taken under it, particularly through data collection and analysis of performance indicators. In this regard, I voted in favour of the recommendation for the renewal of the narrated Agreement.

name: João FERREIRA
text: in writing. - The first scientific and technological cooperation agreement between the EU and Ukraine was signed in July 2002, adopted by the Council on 6 February 2003. It was an agreement whose content was based on areas of cooperation in environmental and climate research, biomedical, health, research in agriculture, forestry and fisheries, industrial technologies, raw materials and production, as well as research in the field of transport, social sciences and training, including exchange of scientists. The content of the renewed agreement is identical to the agreement which expired in November 2014. It will allow both parties to improve and step up their cooperation in science and technology in areas of common interest and allow for greater exchange of specific knowledge and the transfer of know-how. We are, in principle, in favour of establishing cooperation relations in this area. However, the situation in Ukraine cannot be ignored. The illegitimate and undemocratic nature of the Ukrainian government and the coup that brought it to power, as well as the campaigns of hatred, persecution and violence it has promoted, being systematically and brutally trampled on fundamental rights and freedoms, would justify this agreement not being renewed at this time.

name: Monika BEŇOVÁ
text: in writing — The agreement currently in force expired on 7 November 2014. The substantive content of the new agreement will be the same as that of the current agreement. The extension of the duration of the contract in question will make it possible to improve and intensify the cooperation between the European Union and Ukraine in the field of science and technology, where the two parties share common interests. In the future, specific knowledge and know-how should also be exchanged for the benefit of the scientific community, industry and citizens. However, it is necessary to increase the European Commission's oversight of all activities that will be carried out under this Agreement.

name: Lorenzo FONTANA
text: in writing. — The renewal, without amendment every five years, of the agreement in force since 1998 and expiring on 7 November 2014 must be seen in a broader perspective. Now this agreement with Ukraine, given the EU's myopic foreign policy towards Russia in the Ukraine case, cannot have my support. However, in addition to reviewing the issue of sanctions against Russia, I would ask you to deal seriously and objectively with the Ukrainian issue.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: Writing. — I am voting against the renewal of the Agreement on scientific and technological cooperation between the European Community and Ukraine. I am opposed, because at the moment any agreement with Ukraine intensifies the confrontation with Russia, which I consider disastrous for the European Union.

name: Nathan GILL
text: in writing. — The EU has already spent EUR 45 million to sponsor co-operation in research with Eastern European Countries – EUR 26.5 million to the Ukraine, which is not even a member of the EU!  It is wrong to give British taxpayers’ money to non-Member States, when we already give GBP 21 million a day in foreign aid.

name: Juan Carlos GIRAUTA VIDAL
text: in writing. —Ukraine has this year shown unequivocal displays of its willingness to approach the European Union, with which there have been close ties of cooperation that must be renewed. This is the case with the Agreement on Scientific and Technological Cooperation, which expired on 7 November 2014. This Agreement will improve and intensify cooperation in scientific and technological areas of common interest and will make possible a greater exchange of specific and technical knowledge for the benefit of scientific communities, the industrial sector and citizens. To vote in favour is to support all Ukrainian citizens who look to the European Union with hope, showing that it is the path of cooperation that will lead us to a common well-being.

name: Theresa GRIFFIN
text: in writing. — The renewal of the Agreement on cooperation in science and technology between the European Community and Ukraine will benefit the scientific communities, industry and citizens right across Europe.  The previous Agreement allowed for both Parties to improve and intensify their cooperation in science and technology. This renewed Agreement will allow for further exchanges of specific knowledge and for increased market access opportunities and I am happy to support this cause.

name: Antanas GUOGA
text: in writing. — I voted in favour of the renewal of the agreement on cooperation in science and technology between the European Community and Ukraine. This initiative will allow both Parties to improve and intensify the work in the areas of common interests. Moreover, this would lead to further exchange of specific knowledge and know-how which will definitely benefit the scientific communities and the citizens.

name: Eduard-Raul HELLVIG
text: in writing. — I support the recommendation on the renewal of the Agreement on cooperation in science and technology between the European Community and Ukraine. The agreement not only perpetuates a joint act that expired on 7 November 2014, but also strengthens bilateral cooperation at a critical time for Ukraine. The renewal of the Agreement must, in my opinion, be followed by the efficiency, in practice, of cooperation to facilitate access to expert information, to deepen research and innovation, and to make an international use of the results of scientific activities. Research is suffering in Eastern Europe from chronic underfunding and the exodus of specialists, which is starting to have a boomerang effect on the education system and the competitiveness of these societies. That is why I believe that the EU-Ukraine partnership must take into account, especially in the new geopolitical context and Ukraine's orientation towards the system of democratic values, the improvement of local conditions for the development of the expertise of its own specialists.

name: Ian HUDGHTON
text: in writing. — I support the renewal of this agreement, which is mutually beneficial to the scientific communities of the EU and Ukraine.

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: Written. — I voted for a draft legislative resolution on the draft Council decision on the renewal of the Science and Technology Cooperation Agreement between the European Community and Ukraine, on the basis that that Agreement strengthens cooperation, which already exists, in the areas concerned. I also support the fact that the Services of the European Commission will monitor all activities to be carried out under the Agreement and will enable the exchange and transfer of knowledge and skills. Controls should be provided that will take into account the impact indicators and the data collected in order to ensure that the Agreement is carried out in as correct and efficient a manner as possible. In this regard, I consider it positive to intensify cooperation activities with Ukraine in the form of its European path.

name: Marc JOULAUD
text: In writing. "I voted in favour of my colleague Jerzy Buzek's recommendation on the renewal of the scientific and technological cooperation agreement with Ukraine. This agreement, which had been in place since 2002, had already been renewed in 2011 and expired in November 2014, requiring further renewal. The recommendation was adopted by a large majority, which I welcome.

name: Philippe JUVIN
text: In writing. — I voted in favour of the report on the renewal of the scientific and technological cooperation agreement between the European Union and Ukraine, which expired last November. It will enable both sides to improve and intensify their scientific and technological cooperation in areas of common interest, as well as to promote the exchange of knowledge and the transfer of skills.

name: Jarosław KALINOWSKI
text: I would like to write to the Commission. - The development of an effective research and innovation policy to modernise the economy and society is one of the political priorities of both the EU and Ukraine, and it is therefore desirable to renew the Agreement on scientific and technological cooperation between the European Community and Ukraine.  This agreement, first signed in 2003 and renewed twice in 2004 and 2012, establishes a legal basis for cooperation between EU research organisations and many Ukrainian institutions and state bodies. In practice, it will ensure reciprocal access to programmes and activities related to the subject matter of the agreement, non-discrimination, effective protection of intellectual property and effective use of research results.  This agreement allows for further exchange of expertise and also provides a forum where the EU and Ukraine can identify common interests, priorities and tools necessary for scientific and technical cooperation. It is certain that this cooperation will bring many benefits to the scientific community, industry and citizens of both countries.

name: Afzal KHAN
text: in writing. — I agree with renewing the Agreement, as it will improve cooperation between both parties in science and technology and allow further exchange of knowledge and a transfer of know-how for the benefit of scientific communities, industry and the citizens.

name: Giovanni LA VIA
text: in writing. - (IT) Mr President, ladies and gentlemen, I supported Mr De Clercq's report. Jerzy Buzek as this initiative will enable the European Union and Ukraine to improve and intensify cooperation in scientific and technological fields of common interest and will allow the further exchange of specific knowledge, as well as the transfer of know-how for the benefit of the scientific community, businesses and citizens. I am sure that the agreement will strengthen scientific knowledge and offer opportunities for market access.

name: Gabrielius LANDSBERGIS
text: Writing. — This agreement extends the expiry of the EU-Ukraine Agreement on Scientific and Technological Cooperation. This initiative will allow the further exchange of specific knowledge and the transfer of know-how for the benefit of the scientific community, industry, citizens and development.  I support and encourage the various assistance to Ukraine, which is in the presence of an aggressor. We must not forget that in our time, we needed help, and as a representative of Lithuania, I can stress that 24 years ago it was the international community that helped Lithuania escape from the Russian embrace.

name: Javi LÓPEZ
text: in writing. — This is the renewal of the Agreement on Scientific and Technological Cooperation between the European Community and Ukraine, which dates back to 2002 and was last renewed in 2011. It is now re-extended for a new additional five-year period, which is of interest to maintain the continuity of scientific and technological relations between Ukraine and the European Union.

name: Paloma LÓPEZ BERMEJO
text: in writing. — I voted against this report since I cannot accept as legitimate the current Government of Ukraine, which emerged from a coup d'a coup d'a.

name: Antonio LÓPEZ-ISTÚRIZ WHITE
text: in writing. — Renewal of the Agreement with the aim of intensifying the exchange of scientific knowledge for the benefit of scientific communities and citizens. It will be a benefit to the progress of the two sides through cooperation.  Activities under this Agreement will be monitored through performance indicators and data collection.  Considering the mutual benefit that can be drawn from this Agreement, I vote in favour of its enlargement.

name: Ivana MALETIĆ
text: Written. — I supported the report on the renewal of the Agreement on Cooperation between the European Union and Ukraine in the field of science and technology. This initiative will enable both sides to improve and intensify cooperation in the field of science and technology, further exchange of specific knowledge and transfer of know-how, all for the benefit of the scientific community, industry and citizens of both Ukraine and the European Union. The agreement is based on the principles of mutual benefit, mutual access to programmes and activities, non-discrimination, effective protection of intellectual property, equal distribution of intellectual property rights, as well as effective use of results. The renewal of this agreement will allow for an increased concentration of scientific knowledge that will lead to easier market accession.

name: Notis MARIAS
text: Writing. — I voted against the renewal of the Agreement on scientific and technological cooperation between the European Community and Ukraine because I consider that at this stage the adoption of this Agreement does not contribute to the consolidation of peace in the Ukraine region.

name: David MARTIN
text: in writing. — I voted for this Agreement.The Agreement is based on the principles of mutual benefit, reciprocal access to programmes and activities of the other party, in connection with the subject of the Agreement, non-discrimination, effective protection of intellectual property and equitable sharing of IPR and effective exploitation of results. The renewal of this Agreement will allow for increased scientific knowledge leading to market access opportunities.

name: Fulvio MARTUSCIELLO
text: in writing. — (IT) I voted in favour of the draft legislative resolution of the European Parliament on the renewal of the agreement on scientific and technological cooperation between the European Community and Ukraine. The renewal of the agreement will enable both parties to intensify and strengthen cooperation in technological and scientific fields of common interest.

name: Barbara MATERA
text: in writing. — The renewal of the Agreement on scientific and technological cooperation between the European Community and Ukraine will enable cooperation between the parties in the fields of science and technology to be strengthened. That is why I felt it necessary to vote in favour of the Buzek report, which stresses the need for an agreement to facilitate the exchange of scientific knowledge between the two contractors.

name: Georg MAYER
text: Writing. — (DE) I rejected the extension of this agreement because, on the one hand, the circumstances surrounding the civil war in Ukraine are now different from those of its decision, and on the other hand, the European Union's resources would be better taken care of in various other fields of activity.

name: Jean-Luc MÉLENCHON
text: In writing. — On 4 July 2002, the agreement on scientific and technological cooperation between the European Community and Ukraine was signed in Copenhagen. This agreement, which covers many areas of research (environment, transport, agriculture, health, etc.), expired on 7 November 2014. The question here is to renew it in the same terms. In the current context, this is irresponsible. This is a new provocation against Russia. This is even to encourage the adventurous government currently in place in Ukraine, with the participation of neo-Nazis and North American agents. I'm a staunch vote against it.

name: Nuno MELO
text: in writing. — This Agreement is identical to that currently in force and as in force on 7 November 2014. The Agreement is based on the principles of mutual benefit, reciprocity of access to programs and activities of each Party in connection with the subject matter of the Agreement, non-discrimination, effective protection of intellectual property and equitable sharing of intellectual property rights, as well as the effective appreciation of results. The renewal of the Agreement will enable the generation of scientific knowledge that leads to market access opportunities. Hence my vote in favour.

name: Roberta METSOLA
text: in writing. — The renewal of the agreement on cooperation in science and technology with Ukraine will facilitate the plans to develop a ‘Common Knowledge and Innovation Space’ in the Eastern Partnership region of the European Neighbourhood and to help it move forward. Increased EU cooperation with Ukraine will allow for the synchronisation of research priorities and information-sharing in the scientific and technologic sectors. This is why I voted in favour of this recommendation.

name: Louis MICHEL
text: In writing. The scientific and technological cooperation agreement with Ukraine is the result of many years of collaboration. I fully support its renewal, which will enable the European Union and Ukraine to make significant progress in areas of common interest. Strengthening their reciprocal scientific and technological participation will bring mutual benefits to scientific communities, industries and citizens on both sides. I welcome this agreement, which is part of the continuity of the process of rapprochement between Ukraine and the Union, marked by the association agreement recently signed and which we can welcome.

name: Marlene MIZZI
text: in writing. — I support the renewal of the Agreement on cooperation in science and technology with Ukraine since the current Agreement expired on 7 November 2014. This Agreement will allow both Parties to improve and intensify their cooperation in science and technology in areas of common interest, and will allow further exchange of specific knowledge and a transfer of know-how to the benefit of the scientific communities, industry and the citizens.

name: Sophie MONTEL
text: In writing. We are being asked here to decide on the renewal (identical to the previous one and for a period of five years) of the agreement on scientific and technological cooperation between the European Union and Ukraine. The agreement will enable the European Union and Ukraine to "benefit from the scientific and technical progress made through research cooperation within their respective specific research programmes and facilitate further cooperation." It is, of course, in line with previous votes on free trade and Ukraine's possible accession to the Union. This agreement unquestionably violates the sovereignty of the Member States, which are obliged to cooperate by decision of the Union, of a supranational entity. A Union that continues its geopolitical maneuvers against Russia and its attempts to Europeanize Ukraine. I voted against it.

name: Claude MORAES
text: in writing. — I believe that the renewal of the Agreement on cooperation in science and technology between the European Community and Ukraine for five years would be in the interests of both parties so as to maintain continuity in the scientific and technological relations.

name: Alessia Maria MOSCA
text: in writing. — (IT) We have voted in favour of renewing this agreement on scientific and technological cooperation between the European Union and Ukraine, since this initiative will enable both parties to improve and intensify cooperation in scientific and technological fields of common interest and will allow the further exchange of specific knowledge and the transfer of know-how for the benefit of the scientific community, businesses and citizens. The agreement is based on the principles of mutual benefit, mutual access to programmes and activities, non-discrimination, effective protection of intellectual property, fair distribution of intellectual property rights and effective exploitation of results. We are convinced that this renewal will strengthen scientific knowledge and offer greater opportunities for both European and Ukrainian citizens to gain access to the scientific and technological market.

name: Alessandra MUSSOLINI
text: in writing. — The scientific and technological cooperation agreement with Ukraine enables both parties to improve cooperation in technological and scientific fields by allowing the exchange of specific knowledge for the benefit of businesses, citizens and the entire scientific community. I therefore voted in favour of renewing the agreement, so that opportunities for market access can be developed and at the same time scientific knowledge can be strengthened.

name: Franz OBERMAYR
text: Writing. - This request deals with the continuation of cooperation with Ukraine in scientific and technical fields. It is true that, in principle, there is nothing to prevent such cooperation. However, the specific circumstances of the individual case must also be assessed and, in view of the very tense situation in the region at the moment, I think it is appropriate to postpone the matter. That is why I abstained.

name: Younous OMARJEE
text: In writing. I voted against this agreement between the Union and Ukraine, because although it is of some interest in itself, Ukraine's external and internal political situation does not allow for the development of peaceful, democratic and impartial cooperation.

name: Urmas PAET
text: Writing. — I supported the extension of the Agreement on Scientific and Technological Cooperation between the European Union and Ukraine, because I believe that strengthening cooperation and exchanging professional knowledge will bring mutual benefits and increase market access opportunities. This is especially so in view of the current situation in Ukraine and the importance of cooperation with the EU.

name: Aldo PATRICIELLO
text: in writing. — Considering that the initiative will ensure that both parties improve and intensify cooperation in scientific fields by promoting the exchange of knowledge for the benefit of the scientific community and enterprises and that the agreement is based on mutual access to the programmes and activities of the other Party in relation to the subject matter of the Agreement, I intend to vote in favour.

name: Andrej PLENKOVIĆ
text: Written. — With a view to maintaining the continuity of cooperation between the European Community and Ukraine in the field of science and technology and following the expiry of that Agreement on 7 November 2014, which legally signed this cooperation, I support the EP's recommendation to invite the Council to take a decision on the renewal of the Science and Technology Cooperation Agreement with Ukraine.  Given that the Agreement was based on the principle of reciprocity, ukraine and the EU benefited from the signing, primarily due to the enabled access to programmes, activities and achievements in the field of science and technology, as well as the continuous exchange of best practice. The renewal of this Agreement will enable the continuation of the exchange of scientific achievements, as well as help create new opportunities in markets in Ukraine and the EU. The extension of the Agreement is technical in nature and the new Agreement will have identical content to that which expired in November 2014.  Accordingly, as well as taking into account the ratification of the EU-Ukraine Association Agreement, I believe that the EU should continue its cooperation in science and technology with Ukraine.

name: Miroslav POCHE
text: in writing. — The Agreement on scientific and technological cooperation between the European Community and Ukraine was first signed in Copenhagen in 2002 and has been extended regularly ever since. I believe that renewing the agreement for the next five years would be in the best interests of both parties. This process is very well timed. It is, of course, very important to maintain the continuity of relations between Ukraine and the European Union in the field of science and technology. At the same time, however, another clear signal will also be sent that the European Union is firmly convinced of ukraine's future within the Community of European States.

name: Salvatore Domenico POGLIESE
text: in writing. — (IT) In general, the renewed agreement will be very similar to the one that expired a short time ago: but there is also provision for better cooperation in the scientific and technological field which will benefit both businesses and citizens. In addition, and this is another reason for voting in favour, the Commission and the relevant services will continue to monitor the actions covered by the agreement, and I also think it is important that the EU review is based on concrete elements such as efficiency and data collection. I am convinced that the renewal of the agreement will help to improve scientific knowledge with better market access.

name: Jiří POSPÍŠIL
text: in writing. — As early as 4 July 2002, the Agreement on Scientific and Technological Cooperation between the European Community and Ukraine was signed in Copenhagen. The further renewal of this Agreement will contribute to maintaining the continuity of relations between Ukraine and the European Union in the field of science and technology over the next five years, which is necessary, especially in view of the current complicated situation in which Ukraine is in a state of crisis. Developments to date have clearly shown that cooperation is mutually beneficial in the field of science and technology. I believe that the renewal of this agreement will make it possible to better share and exploit knowledge in this area, which will ultimately create opportunities for market access. With this in mind, I have decided to vote in favour of the proposal.

name: Franck PROUST
text: In writing. " Through this text, the European Parliament must consider the renewal of the scientific and technological agreement with Ukraine. This collaboration seems to me to be beneficial for each party, let alone in view of the current situation. So I'm voting in favor.

name: Paulo RANGEL
text: in writing. — having the effect of the Agreement on Scientific and Technological Cooperation between the European Community and Ukraine ended on 7 November 2014, I voted in favour of this resolution, which approves the renewal of that Agreement, in order to ensure that the Parties can continue the exchange of scientific knowledge and the transfer of know-how for the benefit of their scientific communities , industry and citizens.

name: Inma RODRÍGUEZ-PIÑERO
text: in writing. — With the renewal of this Agreement, the European Union and Ukraine will be able to continue to develop their collaboration in the field of scientific and technological relations over the next five years. It is an Agreement based on the principles of mutual benefit, reciprocal access to programmes and activities of the other party related to the purpose of the Agreement, non-discrimination, effective protection of intellectual property, equitable distribution of industrial property rights and effective exploitation of results. Therefore, you have counted on my support.

name: Claude ROLIN
text: In writing. — I voted in favour of the Council's draft decision on the renewal of the scientific and technological cooperation agreement between the European Community and Ukraine. This agreement is still in force but expired on 7 November 2014. Its renewal will therefore enable both sides to improve and intensify their scientific and technological cooperation in areas of common interest and will enable an exchange of specific knowledge and a transfer of know-how for the benefit of the scientific communities, industry and the citizen.

name: Fernando RUAS
text: in writing. — The Agreement on Scientific and Technological Cooperation between the EU and Ukraine focuses on the principles of mutual benefit, reciprocity of access to programmes and activities of each party, non-discrimination, effective protection of intellectual property (and fair sharing of intellectual property), as well as the effective enhancement of results, principles pursued by the European Union.  The renewal of this Agreement, of equal content to the previous one, will enhance and improve cooperation in scientific and technological areas of common interest, as well as the further exchange of specific knowledge and transfer of know-how for the benefit of scientific communities, industry and citizens, leading to opportunities for market access. It will also make it possible for the Commission services to regularly monitor.  For the foregoing, I voted in favour of the recommendation made.

name: Matteo SALVINI
text: in writing. - (IT) I have chosen to vote against because the agreement does not take into account the completely changed and deteriorated political scenario; Moreover, a renewal of the agreement so quickly seems instrumental.

name: Maria Lidia SENRA RODRÍGUEZ
text: in writing. - I voted against this report as I cannot accept as legitimate the current Government of Ukraine, which emerged from a coup d'a coup d'a. Therefore, I voted against it.

name: Siôn SIMON
text: in writing. — Today I welcomed the renewal of the Agreement on cooperation in science and technology between the European Community and Ukraine.  The material content of the renewed Agreement will be identical to that of the current Agreement, which expired on 7 November 2014. The present initiative will allow both Parties to improve and intensify their cooperation in science and technology in areas of common interest and will allow further exchange of specific knowledge and a transfer of know-how to the benefit of the scientific communities, industry and the citizens.

name: Michaela ŠOJDROVÁ
text: in writing. — I voted in support of the Agreement on Scientific and Technological Cooperation between the European Union and Ukraine. I welcome the continuation of this agreement on the grounds that Ukraine is facing a number of reforms and data and developments in the areas of economy, social policy or demographic development are necessary for their preparation and advocating. The agreement foresees joint activities, for example, in social sciences research, in the preparation and exchange of scientists. I know that Ukraine is planning education reforms and will therefore need involvement in research projects and studies to help set up an effective education policy. Until now, Ukraine does not have relevant quantitative or qualitative data and is not involved in international comparative research. This is just one of the areas that point to the need for cooperation, which should bring about improvements for the citizens of Ukraine.

name: Davor Ivo STIER
text: Written. — Due to the particularly difficult political, economic and social situation facing Ukraine, I support this initiative to help the growth and renewal of Ukrainian society, especially when it comes to the scientific field. Cooperation in the field of science and technology enables the dissemination of knowledge, gaining experience, economic and economic growth, growth of production, growth of industries. This will have a positive consequence of creating new jobs. The European Union is one of the world leaders in the development of technology and science. In this way, there will be an exchange of experience and views between scientists, which will certainly contribute to the development and training of Ukrainian experts, but also European ones, as they will be able to learn and apply the experience gained so far. Science is known to be an area that generates the development of society and stimulates economics, so I support this report.

name: Dubravka ŠUICA
text: Written. — With the adoption of this agreement, we have once again shown solidarity with the Ukrainian people, who have found it difficult to have a situation that is extremely reminiscent of the events in Croatia of the 1990s. This is one of the reasons why I supported it, but also other initiatives that will help the growth of Ukraine, in every segment, and especially in scientific.  Cooperation in the field of science and technology enables the dissemination of knowledge, gaining experience, economic and economic growth, growth of production and growth of industries. This will have a positive consequence, creating new jobs. The European Union is among the world leaders in the field of technology and science development. In this way, our experts will certainly contribute to the development and training of Ukrainian experts, and Europe will also be able to learn and apply the experience gained in various programmes.  Priorities need to be set, and science should certainly be among them. I hope there will be more initiatives like this.

name: Richard SULÍK
text: in writing — I agree with the proposal because I support the removal of barriers and barriers between countries, including in the area of cooperation on science and technology. The agreement concluded so far has been beneficial to both parties, so thanks to its renewal, both sides will be able to continue to gain scientific cooperation with each other.

name: Eleftherios SYNADINOS
text: Writing. — While efforts should be made to improve relations between the EU and Russia, this agreement undermines this kind of intention.

name: Tibor SZANYI
text: Writing. — I voted in favour of the renewal of the Agreement between the European Community and Ukraine on scientific and technological cooperation. Ukraine's development in the scientific and technological field, as well as its connectivity to European and international scientific networks and access to know-how, play a major role in the country's European integration and economic stability.  In the European Union, too, we see one response to economic development in strengthening R&D and innovation activities, which is no different for Ukraine.  The current state of the Ukrainian economy and the situation of the Ukrainian energy sector also have an impact on the European Union. However, scientific and technological cooperation is an area that can greatly improve them and contribute to the stability and development of the country, and thus of the region as a whole.

name: Marc TARABELLA
text: In writing. "I voted in favour of Jerzy Buzek's proposal. It makes sense when you take into account that the content of the renewed agreement is identical to that of the agreement that was currently in force until 3 weeks ago. This initiative will enable both sides to improve and intensify their scientific and technological cooperation in areas of common interest and enable an exchange of specific knowledge and a transfer of know-how for the benefit of the scientific communities, industry and the citizen.

name: Ruža TOMAŠIĆ
text: Written. — I support the decision to renew the Science and Technology Cooperation Agreement between the European Community and Ukraine. Taking into account the cooperation between the European Community and Ukraine so far, I believe that the renewal of the Agreement for an additional five years will be in the interest of both Parties in order to maintain the continuity of scientific and technological cooperation, and will allow for further exchange and transfer of knowledge and experience for the benefit of the scientific community, industry and citizens. Access to and sharing of research institutions, exchange of information on the practices of laws, regulations and programmes are very important for the cooperation on which this Agreement is based.

name: Marie-Christine VERGIAT
text: In writing. — The scientific and technological cooperation agreement signed in July 2002 by the EU and Ukraine has expired.  In theory, therefore, it is simply a question of renewing this Union-Ukraine cooperation agreement on technological and scientific matters. The areas of cooperation concerned include industrial and production technologies, social and information technologies and the training and exchange of scientists. However, the renewal of such an agreement cannot be appreciated regardless of the political situation in Ukraine and the play of the European Union, a dangerous game that my group of the European Unitarian Left-Green Left has repeatedly denounced, refusing in particular to see the Ukrainian government as a paragon of virtue in matters of democracy and justice. So I voted against this agreement.

name: Miguel VIEGAS
text: in writing. — The European Union, in the act of international law, has decided to support the coup d'état in Ukraine in a total following against the United States and NATO. Following this intervention, the EU had to provide financial support to ukraine's illegal government, despite the numerous crimes committed against civilian populations, both by the government and by the forces supporting it. It had to sign a trade agreement with Ukraine (which was recently extended for another year), which opens our borders to products produced in that country, particularly those that were exported to Russia, without reciprocity in relation to European production. It had to suffer a Russian embargo on European exports of various agri-food products, with enormous damage to producers. Finally, it is paying off Ukraine's accumulated debts because of the purchase of natural gas from Russian companies, under penalty of compromising the supply of gas to central European countries.   For our part, we do not recognize any legitimacy to the group of people who have taken power in this country in the absentia of international law. In this sense, we do not subscribe to this agreement, or any other agreement, until institutional legality is replaced.

name: Harald VILIMSKY
text: Writing. — Given the current situation in eastern Ukraine and the resulting tensions between Russia, Ukraine and the EU, I consider any extensions of agreements in which the EU clearly refers to parties to be obsolete and I abstained on this motion. I also think that the European Union's resources would certainly be better placed in other sectors that affect the EU itself.

name: Kristina WINBERG
text: in writing. — Ukraine has been identified as one of 11 key strategic partners and the only country in Eastern Europe to join the EU scientific and innovation programme Horizon 2020. In the past Ukraine actively participated in the predecessor of the Horizon 2020 programme, the EU’s 7th Framework Programme on research, which took place in 2007-2013 and covered 309 projects of Eastern countries costing EUR 45 million. Ukraine captured EUR 26.5 million of those funds.  I do not wish to give consent to this agreement.

name: Iuliu WINKLER
text: in writing. - I voted on the EP recommendation to renew the Agreement on cooperation in science and technology with Ukraine, which expired on 7 November this year. This agreement is based on the principle of mutual advantage and access to the scientific and technological programmes and activities of the other Party, ensuring the protection of intellectual property, the fair distribution of intellectual property rights and the effective exploitation of results. The renewal of this agreement will increase scientific knowledge, which will lead to the creation of market access opportunities. In particularly difficult conditions in which our neighbours are located to the east, the EP must responsibly use all avenues to strengthen EU-Ukraine cooperation, including by strengthening the legal framework of this bilateral cooperation.

name: Janusz ZEMKE
text: I would like to write to the Commission. — I voted in favour of renewing the agreement on scientific and technological cooperation with Ukraine. This EP decision is necessary as the term of the agreement expired on 7 November 2014. I can only express my surprise in this regard that we are taking this decision more than a month after the expiry of the existing agreement, when it has been known for many months that effective assistance to Ukraine also requires the support of its scientific and technological cooperation with the EU.  Ukraine is at a watershed moment in its history. The most important thing is that the country is internally strengthened and able to stimulate its own development. For only a well-organised and modernising Ukraine has a chance to preserve its independence. However, this agreement cannot be just a paper record. The Services of the European Commission should support the exchange of specialists between Ukraine and EU countries and the transfer of expertise to Ukraine. I would like to express my conviction that the renewal of the agreement will make it possible to increase scientific knowledge in Ukraine and thus to boost its access to the European market.

name: Marina ALBIOL GUZMÁN
text: in writing. — This report is purely technical in nature, as Croatia's participation in the European Economic Area is a consequence of its accession to the EU. But, even if so, I have not been able to vote in favour, since I believe it is for the Croatian people to decide whether or not to join the EU and, therefore, whether they want to enter into the neoliberal economic logic of the Union. That's why I abstained.

name: Marie-Christine ARNAUTU
text: In writing. "Like my colleagues in the National Front delegation, I voted against this recommendation. Croatia's participation in the European Economic Area is another step forward in this mad race for enlargement. The less your Europe works, the more you want to enlarge it, probably hoping that this endless growth would delay the bankruptcy. But the European peoples are no longer fooled and everywhere the grumbling rises against Brussels centralism. In the interest of the Croatian people, I would have liked them to escape your sprawling monster, your eurocracy, which is sure to bring it to its knees, as it has already done with the Greek, Spanish, Irish, Portuguese and soon French peoples.

name: Jonathan ARNOTT
text: in writing. — This is a technical matter concerning Croatia; therefore I abstained on it.

name: Petras AUŠTREVIČIUS
text: in writing. — Croatia’s admission as a new contracting party to the European Economic Area should be congratulated as an essential milestone event for the country to become a fully-fledged Member State and participant of the Union.  Looking back on Croatia’s accession to the EU, one must take into account that its integration process entails both political and economic dimensions which needless to say are highly interconnected. This means that only by being economically engaged can a country be fully politically involved in EU decision making. Hence, making these new economic ties between the EU and Croatia results not only in free flow of goods and services but also in joint economic and trade policy and shared expertise and cooperation in such areas as innovation, development and consumer protection, which in turn will benefit not only Croatia but the European Union’s economy as a whole.

name: Zigmantas BALČYTIS
text: Writing. — I voted in favour of this proposal, which aims to accession Croatia to the European Economic Area (EEA). In order to facilitate Croatia's participation in the EEA, the following agreements are hereby concluded: the Agreement on the participation of the Republic of Croatia in the EEA, Norway and the EU agreement for the period 2009-2014. Additional Protocol to the Additional Protocol to the Norwegian Financial Mechanism and to the Agreement between the European Economic Community and Iceland. The EEA Agreement provides for the application of EU legislation covering four freedoms (free movement of goods, services, persons and capital) in all EEA States. It also covers cooperation in other areas such as research and development, education, social policy, the environment, consumer protection, etc. I believe that Croatia's participation in the EEA is a normal consequence of its accession to the EU and I therefore support it.

name: Nicolas BAY
text: In writing. I do not wish to encourage Croatia to become more involved in a system which I believe is doomed to fail under the current conditions.

name: Hugues BAYET
text: In writing. "I voted in favour of Croatia's participation in the European Economic Area, because it is a consequence of its accession to the European Union. The EEA agreement provides for the integration of EU legislation on the four freedoms (free movement of goods, services, people and capital) in all EEA countries.

name: Izaskun BILBAO BARANDICA
text: in writing. — I supported this report because, with the entry into the Croatian EU and in order to allow its participation in the European Economic Area, there are Council decisions under review which aim to conclude certain texts. The EEA Agreement brings together EU Member States and three members of the European Free Trade Association (Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway) in a single market. The EEA Agreement provides for the inclusion of EU legislation on the four freedoms (free movement of goods, services, persons and capital) in all EEA countries. The Agreement also covers cooperation in other important areas such as research and development, education, social policy, the environment, consumer protection, tourism and culture, known together as "horizontal and complementary" policies. The Agreement guarantees equal rights and obligations within the internal market for EEA citizens and economic operators.

name: Dominique BILDE
text: In writing. The European Economic Area brings together the EU Member States and three Member States of the European Free Trade Association (EFTA) in a single market, Iceland, Norway and Liechtenstein.  This agreement naturally provides for the integration of European legislation on the four freedoms of the free movement of people, goods, services and capital.  This recommendation should enable Croatia, the new European state, to participate in the EEA and, of course, reflects the whole philosophy of the European Union, which aims at ever more liberalism and leads to the ruin of the Peoples of Europe; that is why I voted against this text.

name: Mara BIZZOTTO
text: in writing. — (IT) Since the single market, as it continues to be structured, is a source of inconvenience, inefficiency and unfair competition, I abstained in principle in the vote on this measure, which merely gives the Council the task of taking the necessary measures to establish Croatia's participation in the European Economic Area.

name: José BLANCO LÓPEZ
text: in writing. — The European Economic Area (EEA), in force since 1994, brings together EU Member States and three members of the European Free Trade Association (Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway) in a single market. The EEA Agreement provides for the inclusion of EU legislation on the four freedoms (free movement of goods, services, persons and capital) in all EEA countries. The Agreement also covers cooperation in other important areas such as research and development, education, social policy, the environment, consumer protection, tourism and culture, known together as "horizontal and complementary" policies. The Agreement also guarantees equal rights and obligations within the internal market for EEA citizens and economic operators. Croatia's participation in the EEA is a natural consequence of its accession to the EU and therefore approval should be given to the conclusion of the Agreement on Croatia's participation in the EEA and its additional protocols. That is why I voted in favour of this report.

name: Vilija BLINKEVIČIŪTĖ
text: Writing. — I voted in favour of this report because it supports the conclusion of the Agreement on the participation of Croatia in the European Economic Area (hereinafter referred to as the EEA Agreement) and the conclusion of three related agreements on behalf of the EU. The EEA Agreement was signed in 1992 and Croatia undertakes to accede to this Agreement under the conditions laid down in its Act of Accession. Under the EEA Agreement, EU Member States and three members of the European Free Trade Association – Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway – are united in the single market, where the free movement of goods, services, persons and capital is in force in all EEA States. Croatia's participation in the European Economic Area is a self-evident consequence of its accession to the EU, and parliament has therefore supported this agreement.

name: Mercedes BRESSO
text: in writing. — I sincerely supported the conclusion of the agreement for the Croatian participation to the EEA. As a neighbour country to Italy, Croatia must be absolutely integrated in the European Market.

name: Steeve BRIOIS
text: In writing. — The European Economic Area (EEA) brings together the EU Member States and three Member States of the European Free Trade Association (EFTA) in a single market, Iceland, Norway and Liechtenstein. This agreement provides for the integration of EU legislation on the four freedoms of the free movement of people, goods, services and capital. With the adoption of this recommendation, Croatia, the new MEMBER state of the Union, will participate in the EEA. Firmly opposed to ultraliberal dogma and to the free and undistorted competition that led to deindustrialization and mass unemployment in France, I voted against this text.

name: Daniel BUDA
text: in writing. — I voted in favour of the Recommendation on the draft Council decision on the signing, on behalf of the European Union, of the Agreement on the participation of the Republic of Croatia in the European Economic Area. The Agreement on the European Economic Area was signed on 2 May 1992 and entered into force on 1 January 1994. Today, more than 20 years after its entry into force, the agreement is having positive effects on the whole of the European Union and in particular on the new members. The proposal on Croatia's participation in the European Economic Area is absolutely natural in fulfilling Croatia's eu accession path and creates the legal instrument by which Croatia fully benefits from the effects of EU membership.

name: Gianluca BUONANNO
text: in writing. — Since Croatia has joined the EU, its participation in the European Economic Area must also be recognised. With this vote, the European Parliament is giving its consent to the Council to take the necessary measures. I do not entirely agree with the application of the principles underlying the single market (movement of goods, services, people and capital), so I abstained.

name: Soledad CABEZÓN RUIZ
text: in writing. — The EEA, in force since 1994, brings together EU Member States and three members of the European Free Trade Association (Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway) in a single market. The EEA Agreement provides for the inclusion of EU legislation on the four freedoms (free movement of goods, services, persons and capital) in all EEA countries. The Agreement also covers cooperation in other important areas such as research and development, education, social policy, the environment, consumer protection, tourism and culture, known together as "horizontal and complementary" policies. The Agreement guarantees equal rights and obligations within the internal market for EEA citizens and economic operators. Croatia's participation in the EEA is a natural consequence of its accession to the EU and therefore approval should be given to the conclusion of the Agreement on Croatia's participation in the EEA and its additional protocols. The INTA committee ruled almost unanimously in favour of granting approval.

name: Alain CADEC
text: In writing. — The Agreement on the European Economic Area was signed in 1992. This agreement creates a free trade area between all EU member states, Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway. With Croatia's accession to the EU in 2013, all international agreements, trade or other, must be extended to this new Member State. I voted in favour of this report, which stresses the importance of adapting the European legislative framework to the structural changes taking place within the Union.

name: Nicola CAPUTO
text: in writing. — (IT) Today I voted in favour of Croatia's participation in the European Economic Area (EEA). I believe that Croatia's accession to the EEA is a natural consequence of its accession to the European Union in July 2013. As Croatia is a new EU Member State, it is entirely logical that it should also have the opportunity to participate in the EEA Agreement, which brings together the EU Member States and the three members of the European Free Trade Association, namely Norway, Lichtenstein and Iceland, in a single market involving the free movement of goods, services, persons and capital.

name: James CARVER
text: in writing. - I abstained on this issue, which tidies up a technicality about Croatia, which is now an EU member.  Its relationship with the EEA has accordingly changed.

name: Fabio Massimo CASTALDO
text: in writing. — (IT) With the adoption of this resolution, the necessary legal measures are taken to complete croatia's integration into the European Economic Area.

name: Salvatore CICU
text: in writing. — (IT) I voted in favour of Croatia's participation in the European Economic Area because I believe that this is a natural consequence of its accession to the EU. That is why I am in favour of Parliament approving the conclusion of the agreement on Croatia's participation in the European Economic Area.

name: Alberto CIRIO
text: in writing. — (IT) The vote on this proposal is entirely favourable, I would almost say obvious: now that Croatia is an EU Member State, it is in its own right and not half-hearted. Consequently, It seems to me perfectly normal for Croatia to participate fully in all the for a of the Member States, including the European Economic Area. This act is a formality and it had to be approved.

name: Carlos COELHO
text: in writing. — The Agreement on the European Economic Area (EEA Agreement) was signed on 2 May 1992 and entered into force on 1 January 1994. This agreement provides for the introduction of EU legislation on the four freedoms - the free movement of goods, services, people and capital - in all ees countries. The agreement includes cooperation in other important areas such as research and development, education, social policy, the environment, consumer protection, tourism and culture. The agreement guarantees citizens and economic operators who are part of the EEA equal rights and obligations in the internal market. This proposal is the legal instrument for concluding the Agreement on the participation of the Republic of Croatia in the EEA and its additional protocol to the Agreement with the Kingdom of Norway and the European Union on the Norwegian Financial Mechanism for the period 2014-2019, following Croatia's participation in the EEA. Croatia's participation in the EEA is therefore a natural consequence of its accession to the EU on 1 July 2013. It is therefore natural that, more than a year after its entry into the EU, the Commission and the Council should take the necessary legal measures to make croatia's participation in the EEA possible.

name: Lara COMI
text: in writing. - (IT) I supported, with my vote in favour, this recommendation approving croatia's participation agreement in the European Economic Area and three other related agreements.  I believe, in fact, that this country's participation in the EEA area is a natural consequence of its recent accession to the European Union. Furthermore, as a result of this agreement, Croatia undertakes to adhere to the conditions laid down, and this will undoubtedly have a positive effect on the common European market.

name: Therese COMODINI CACHIA
text: in writing. — The proposed agreements make the Republic of Croatia a contracting party to the EEA Agreement. The Protocol includes Croatia in the Norwegian Financial Mechanism. The EEA Agreement brings together the EU Member States and the three members of the European Free Trade Association – Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway – in a single market. It provides for the inclusion of EU legislation covering the four freedoms throughout all the EEA States. In addition, the Agreement guarantees equal rights and obligations within the internal market for citizens and economic operators in the EEA. The participation of Croatia in the European Economic Area is a natural consequence of its EU accession, therefore I voted in favour.

name: Ignazio CORRAO
text: in writing. — The Agreement on the European Economic Area (EEA Agreement) was signed on 2 May 1992 and entered into force on 1 January 1994. Pursuant to the Act of Accession of the Republic of Croatia, the Republic of Croatia undertakes to accede, under the conditions laid down in the Act, to the Agreement on the European Economic Area, in accordance with Article 128 of the Agreement. The EEA Agreement brings together EU Member States and the three members of the European Free Trade Association – Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway – in a single market. The EEA Agreement provides for the inclusion of EU legislation on the four freedoms – the free movement of goods, services, persons and capital – in all EEA states. In addition, the agreement provides for cooperation in other important areas such as research and development, education, social policy, the environment, consumer protection, tourism and culture, collectively known as 'accompanying and horizontal' policies. The agreement guarantees equal rights and obligations within the framework of the internal market for citizens and economic operators in the EEA. In view of this, I could only vote in favour in order to allow Croatia to participate in the European Economic Area.

name: Javier COUSO PERMUY
text: in writing. — This report is purely technical in nature, as Croatia's participation in the European Economic Area is a consequence of its accession to the EU. But, even if so, I have not been able to vote in favour, since I believe it is for the Croatian people to decide whether or not to join the EU and, therefore, whether they want to enter into the neoliberal economic logic of the Union. That's why I abstained.

name: Miriam DALLI
text: in writing. - The European Economic Area agreement provides for the inclusion of EU legislation covering the four freedoms (the free movement of goods, services, persons and capital) throughout all the EEA states. In addition, the Agreement covers cooperation in other important areas such as research and development, education, social policy, environment and tourism. I voted in favour of this report to support the conclusion of the agreement on the participation of Croatia in the EEA, to finally take account of the accession of Croatia to the EU.

name: Viorica DĂNCILĂ
text: in writing. — I welcome the vote on the participation of the Republic of Croatia in the European Economic Area and I believe that it comes as a consequence of its accession to the European Union.

name: Rachida DATI
text: In writing. Following its accession to the European Union in 2013, it makes perfect sense to involve Croatia in this agreement, which brings together the Member States of the European Union with Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway in a single market. In particular, Croatia will be able to legitimately participate in cooperation in the key areas of tourism, research and development and education.

name: Isabella DE MONTE
text: in writing. — I voted in favour of concluding the agreement on Croatia's participation in the European Economic Area signed on 2 May 1992 and entered into force on 1 January 1994. This accession is a step towards the full integration of the Republic of Croatia into the European Union.

name: Mireille D'ORNANO
text: In writing. — The report put to the vote is a continuation of Croatia's integration process under the tutelage of the European Union and its submission to free trade organised by those same institutions, which is why I voted against it.

name: Pablo ECHENIQUE
text: in writing. — We voted in favour as this is a natural consequence of Croatia's entry into the EU. As a result of this entry in July 2013, Croatia undertook to accede, under the conditions laid down in its Act of Accession, to the Agreement signed by the EU on the European Economic Area (EEA) in 1992. The EEA Agreement brings together EU Member States and three members of the European Free Trade Association – Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway – in a single market. The EEA Agreement provides for the inclusion of EU legislation on the four freedoms — the free movement of goods, services, persons and capital — in all EEA States. It covers cooperation in areas such as research and development, education, social policy, the environment, consumer protection, tourism and culture. The Agreement guarantees, in principle, equal rights and obligations in the internal market for citizens and economic operators in the EEA.

name: Georgios EPITIDEIOS
text: Writing. — I voted against the plan, as the enlargement of the EU and the consequent participation of Member States or acceding States in economic agreements does not contribute at all to solving the economic problems plaguing the countries of the South and in need of urgent resolution, but rather widens the North-South economic gap.

name: José Manuel FERNANDES
text: in writing. - Croatia's accession to the European Union about a year ago should have as a natural consequence its participation in the European Economic Area, which advocates the free movement of goods, services, persons and capital. In addition, the Agreement includes cooperation in other important areas such as research and development, education, social policy, the environment, consumer protection, tourism and culture, collectively known as horizontal and framework policies. It is therefore entirely normal that, more than a year after accession, the Commission and the Council have taken the necessary legal measures to make croatia's participation in this European area possible, assuming its full status as a Member State.

name: João FERREIRA
text: in writing. — This report recommends the adoption of the conclusion of the Agreement on Croatia's participation in the European Economic Area (EEA).  In view of Croatia's accession to the European Union, it is necessary to conclude different Agreements and Protocols in order to effect croatia's participation in the EEA, i.e. this is one of the consequences of accession, which is naturally due to it. This is therefore an eminently technical report. Being known our general position on whether new countries join the European Union – without ignoring the nature and meaning of integration and their enlargement processes, it is up to each people to decide freely and sovereignly on whether or not to join the EU – which has led to an abstention in croatia's accession process, it is natural that this will lead to the same sense of voting on decisions or processes that fall within the framework of the consequences of such adtake. That is why we are also abstaining in this report.

name: Monika BEŇOVÁ
text: in writing — The Agreement on the European Economic Area brings together the Member States of the European Union and three EFTA members — Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway — in the single market. The EEA Agreement provides for the inclusion of European Union legislation covering all four fundamental freedoms – the free movement of persons, services, goods and capital across all EEA members. Furthermore, the agreement in question also includes cooperation in important areas such as research and development, education, social policy, the environment, consumer protection and, last but not least, cultures. The agreement guarantees equal rights and obligations without distinction for all economic operators and citizens within the internal market. It is important that an agreement be concluded on Croatia's participation in the EEA and the related Protocol, taking into account croatia's accession to the European Union.

name: Lorenzo FONTANA
text: in writing. — With Croatia's accession to the EU, its participation in the European Economic Area must now also be sanctioned. With this vote, the European Parliament is giving its consent to the Council to take the necessary measures. However, since the historical and political development of the single market is taking place which do not go in the direction of the good of the vast majority of citizens but which respect the will of the individual Member States, I shall abstain in the vote.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: Writing. — I am voting against the draft Council Decision on the conclusion, on behalf of the European Union, of the Agreement on the participation of the Republic of Croatia in the European Economic Area and three related agreements, as the enlargement of the EU and the consequent participation of Member States or acceding States in economic agreements will not contribute at all to solving the economic problems plaguing the countries of the South and requiring urgent resolution. , but on the contrary they will widen the North-South economic gap.

name: Doru-Claudian FRUNZULICĂ
text: in writing. — Croatian accession to the EEA acknowledges the far-reaching political, economic and institutional reforms, the efforts to comply with EU directives and the substantial progress that Croatia achieved before the crisis. It will have many positive impacts for the country: it will strengthen contacts and cooperation between Croatia and the partners of the EEA; it will enhance the competitiveness of the countryʼs economy. Croatia will be able to contribute to and influence the formation of relevant EEA policies and legislation at an early stage as part of a formal decision-shaping process.  Among other things, Croatia will become the 16th beneficiary country of the existing EEA grants scheme. This will help Croatia in reducing the negative effects of the global financial crisis such as negative economic growth, unemployment rising by over 14% and youth unemployment by up to 40%. Croatiaʼs accession increases the EU area of political stability, expands the EUʼs internal market, extends EU standards and creates new opportunities for EU industries, entrepreneurs and customers. I welcome this new membership since I strongly believe that the European Union as a whole will benefit from it.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: in writing. - We voted in favour as this is a natural consequence of Croatia's entry into the EU. As a result of this entry in July 2013, Croatia undertook to accede, under the conditions laid down in its Act of Accession, to the Agreement signed by the EU on the European Economic Area (EEA) in 1992. The EEA Agreement brings together EU Member States and three members of the European Free Trade Association – Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway – in a single market. The EEA Agreement provides for the inclusion of EU legislation on the four freedoms — the free movement of goods, services, persons and capital — in all EEA States. It covers cooperation in areas such as research and development, education, social policy, the environment, consumer protection, tourism and culture. The Agreement guarantees, in principle, equal rights and obligations in the internal market for citizens and economic operators in the EEA.

name: Antanas GUOGA
text: in writing. — I voted in favour for participation of Croatia in the European Economic Area. I support Croatia’s participation in the European Economic Area, because as Croatia is a member of the EU, it is natural consequence that it becomes a member of the EEA.

name: Eduard-Raul HELLVIG
text: in writing. — Croatia's participation in the European Economic Area (SEE), the consequence of EU accession, officially begins at a time when the four pillars on which the SEE Agreement is based are called into question, namely the four fundamental freedoms: the free movement of goods, services, persons and capital - in the 28 EU states plus the 3 Member States of the European Free Trade Association (Iceland Liechtenstein and Norway). Signed in 1992 and entered into force in 1994, the AGREEMENT on the SEE boosted the creation of the European Single Market and contributed to the integration of most of our continent. Calling into question the freedom of movement of people, in the context of the economic crisis and, now, the permanence of stagnation, is a worrying symptom of the potential hostile to the European project. The temptation of protectionist measures may also affect the values and norms that transcend intra-European borders.  That is why I consider it necessary to defend respect for the equal rights of all citizens of the Member States, including the right to free movement on the labour market in all the countries of the European Union. It is a fundamental right, the observance of which the new European Commission is called upon to watch, all the more so as the Europhobic discourse intensifies.

name: Ian HUDGHTON
text: in writing. — Croatia’s participation in the European Economic Area marks a final and logical stage in their full participation in the EU. Croatia's path to independence was troubled, but the country has emerged as a stable and democratic entity. As an independent member of the EU and a fully participating part of the EEA, Croatia will have a full voice in all the key decision-making institutions.

name: Pablo IGLESIAS
text: in writing. - We voted in favour as this is a natural consequence of Croatia's entry into the EU. As a result of this entry in July 2013, Croatia undertook to accede, under the conditions laid down in its Act of Accession, to the Agreement signed by the EU on the European Economic Area (EEA) in 1992. The EEA Agreement brings together EU Member States and three members of the European Free Trade Association – Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway – in a single market. The EEA Agreement provides for the inclusion of EU legislation on the four freedoms — the free movement of goods, services, persons and capital — in all EEA States. It covers cooperation in areas such as research and development, education, social policy, the environment, consumer protection, tourism and culture. The Agreement guarantees, in principle, equal rights and obligations in the internal market for citizens and economic operators in the EEA.

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: Written. — I voted for a draft legislative resolution on the draft Council decision on the conclusion, on behalf of the European Union, of the Agreement on the Participation of the Republic of Croatia in the European Economic Area and three related agreements, as these agreements are of utmost importance in order to enable Croatia to participate fully and operate in the single market. The Agreement on the European Economic Area implies the implementation of the free movement of persons, capital, services and goods, as well as cooperation in a number of other areas such as research, tourism and culture, and environmental protection. Therefore, I think it is very important that Croatia participates fully in the area concerned, which will affect the prosperity and development of the state and represents a natural sequence of accession to the European Union. The conclusion of the Agreement represents an additional synergy of the Republic of Croatia with other Member States that will contribute to all sectors of Croatian society.

name: Marc JOULAUD
text: In writing. "I voted in favour of my colleague Alexander Lambsdorff's recommendation on Croatia's participation in the European Economic Area. In order to take account of Croatia's accession to the Union, additional protocols to the economic agreement between the UNION, Iceland, Norway and Liechtenstein had to be established. The recommendation was adopted by a large majority, which I welcome.

name: Philippe JUVIN
text: In writing. I supported the report on Croatia's participation in the European Economic Area. The European Economic Area establishes a single market to facilitate trade between EU Member States and three European Free Trade Association states such as Iceland, Liechtenstein and Norway. It also provides for the integration of EU legislation on the four freedoms in all the countries of the European Economic Area and governs their cooperation in strategic areas such as research and development, education, social policy and the environment.

name: Afzal KHAN
text: in writing. — I supported the report as it is a technical adjustment to update the EEA following the accession of Croatia to the EU, and allows Croatia to benefit from the single market with Iceland, Lichtenstein and Norway.

name: Giovanni LA VIA
text: in writing. - (IT) Mr President, ladies and gentlemen, I am voting in favour of Mr De Clercq's report. Lambsdorff, Alexander Graf. It is an agreement that will allow Croatia, the twenty-eighth Member State of the European Union, with obligations and benefits, to participate in the EEA Agreement. In this way, it will be possible to bring together all the Member States of the European Union with Norway, Liechtenstein and Iceland.

name: Gabrielius LANDSBERGIS
text: Writing. — The EEA Agreement provides for the application of EU legislation covering four freedoms (free movement of goods, services, persons and capital) in all EEA States. In addition, the agreement covers cooperation in other important areas, such as research and development, education, social policy, the environment, consumer protection, tourism and culture. In favour of deepening EU integration, I voted in favour of Croatia's participation in the European Economic Area as an inevitable act following its accession to the EU.

name: Javi LÓPEZ
